extension.name: org.apache.nifi.hbase.HBase_2_ClientMapCacheService
extension.description: Provides the ability to use an HBase table as a cache, in place of a DistributedMapCache. Uses a HBase_2_ClientService controller to communicate with HBase.

property.name: HBase Cache Table Name
property.description: Name of the table on HBase to use for the cache.

property.name: hb-lu-authorizations
property.description: The list of authorization tokens to be used with cell visibility if it is enabled. These will be used to override the default authorization list for the user accessing HBase.

property.name: hbase-cache-visibility-expression
property.description: The default visibility expression to apply to cells when visibility expression support is enabled.

property.name: HBase Client Service
property.description: Specifies the HBase Client Controller Service to use for accessing HBase.

property.name: HBase Column Family
property.description: Name of the column family on HBase to use for the cache.

property.name: HBase Column Qualifier
property.description: Name of the column qualifier on HBase to use for the cache

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.hbase.HBase_2_ClientService
extension.description: Implementation of HBaseClientService using the HBase 2.1.1 client. This service can be configured by providing a comma-separated list of configuration files, or by specifying values for the other properties. If configuration files are provided, they will be loaded first, and the values of the additional properties will override the values from the configuration files. In addition, any user defined properties on the processor will also be passed to the HBase configuration.

property.name: Hadoop Configuration Files
property.description: Comma-separated list of Hadoop Configuration files, such as hbase-site.xml and core-site.xml for kerberos, including full paths to the files.

property.name: kerberos-user-service
property.description: Specifies the Kerberos User Controller Service that should be used for authenticating with Kerberos

property.name: kerberos-credentials-service
property.description: Specifies the Kerberos Credentials Controller Service that should be used for authenticating with Kerberos

property.name: Kerberos Principal
property.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties

property.name: Kerberos Keytab
property.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties

property.name: Kerberos Password
property.description: Kerberos password associated with the principal.

property.name: ZooKeeper Quorum
property.description: Comma-separated list of ZooKeeper hosts for HBase. Required if Hadoop Configuration Files are not provided.

property.name: ZooKeeper Client Port
property.description: The port on which ZooKeeper is accepting client connections. Required if Hadoop Configuration Files are not provided.

property.name: ZooKeeper ZNode Parent
property.description: The ZooKeeper ZNode Parent value for HBase (example: /hbase). Required if Hadoop Configuration Files are not provided.

property.name: HBase Client Retries
property.description: The number of times the HBase client will retry connecting. Required if Hadoop Configuration Files are not provided.

property.name: Phoenix Client JAR Location
property.description: The full path to the Phoenix client JAR. Required if Phoenix is installed on top of HBase.

dynamicProperty.name: The name of an HBase configuration property.
dynamicProperty.value: The value of the given HBase configuration property.
dynamicProperty.description: These properties will be set on the HBase configuration after loading any provided configuration files.

restriction.explanation: Client JAR Location can reference resources over HTTP

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.hbase.HBase_2_RecordLookupService
extension.description: A lookup service that retrieves one or more columns from HBase and returns them as a record. The lookup coordinates must contain 'rowKey' which will be the HBase row id.

property.name: hbase-client-service
property.description: Specifies the HBase Client Controller Service to use for accessing HBase.

property.name: hb-lu-table-name
property.description: The name of the table where look ups will be run.

property.name: hb-lu-authorizations
property.description: The list of authorization tokens to be used with cell visibility if it is enabled. These will be used to override the default authorization list for the user accessing HBase.

property.name: hb-lu-return-cols
property.description: A comma-separated list of \"<colFamily>:<colQualifier>\" pairs to return when scanning. To return all columns for a given family, leave off the qualifier such as \"<colFamily1>,<colFamily2>\".

property.name: hb-lu-charset
property.description: Specifies the character set used to decode bytes retrieved from HBase.
